bibl.title: In Re: Ex Parte - Turner Jackson Petitioner For A Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US District Court Western Division of Washington, Seattle

div1.p: In The United States Ciruit Court, For the Ninth Juidicial Circuit, Western Division of the State of Washington, Northern Division.
In re. Parte: Turner Jackson, Petitioner. Order of Discharge.

To the Honorable C.B. Hopkins, United States Marshal: It is hereby Ordered and Directed that the above entitled matter having come on regurlarly to be heard before this Court on the 9th day of September, A.D. 1905, Turner Jackson, the petitioner therein, being represented by his counsel, Wm. H. Brinker and Richard Saxe Jones, and the United States of America being represented by the United States Attorney for this District, the Honorable Jesse Frye, and all the matters therein involved being duly heard, and the Court has regularly held and determined that Turner Jackson, a prisoner now held in custody by you at the penitentiary of McNeill's Island, in the state of Washington, is unlawfully held in custody, his term of imprisonment having expired as provided by law.
Therefore, you are herby ordered and directed to forthwith discharge from such custody and imprisonment the said Turner Jackson.
Done under the Soul of this Court this 9th day of Septemeber, A.D. 1905.
Attest:A. Reeves Ayres, clerk. Wm. H Briker Dept. Deputy Clerk of said Court.
filed in the U.S. Circuit Court, Western Dist. of Washington, Sep 18 1905, A Reeves Ayres, Clerk
Office of United States Marshal, District of Washington, Washington

Marshal's return to Order of discharge. In re EX-parte Turner Jackson. I hereby entify that I received the attached order of discharge on the 11th Sept A.D. 1905, tha the Honorable District Court, having immediately subsequent to the reverance of this order granted an an appeal. Made by the United States through its atty. Honorable Jesse A Frays to the United States Circuit Courtof appeals. And having fized the bail os saif Turner Jackson at ten Thousand(10,0000 and he having failed to give said bail I am unable to discharge the said Turner Jackson from the U.SS Petitioning at Mc Neil's Island wash. C.B. Hopkins by John Atington U.S. Marshal. Dated Sept 18 1905, Deputy U.S. Marshall.
